results.title: Investors Race to Escape Risks in Emerging Markets
results.abstract: A selling spree by large mutual funds has raised concerns among regulators and economists about a broader contagion if investors start to ask for their money at the same time.

multimedia.caption: The Chinese yuan. China’s decision to devalue its currency set off a chain reaction of panicked selling around the world.

results.title: Fading Economy and Graft Crackdown Rattle China
results.abstract: A slowdown could mark the end of fast growth, while a campaign against official corruption has continued longer and reached higher than most had expected.
results.byline: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

results.title: Mortgage Provider Reaps Rewards of Lending Boldly

results.title: A Shot, a Glimpse of an AK-47, and U.S. Servicemen Pounced
results.abstract: The action by servicemen on a high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to Paris averted what officials said could have been a blood bath.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: France ramped up security after a 26-year-old Moroccan gunman attacked passengers on a high-speed train heading to Paris. Three Americans, above, and a Frenchman rushed him and knocked him unconscious, preventing what a French official said would have been “a terrible tragedy.”
multimedia.copyright: Left, Philippe Huguen/Agence France-Presse; center and right, Pascal Rossignol/Reuters

results.title: 3 Who Stopped Attack Were Boyhood Friends
results.abstract: The three Americans who subdued a gunman aboard a train to Paris are friends from their middle-school days, and two of them serve in the armed forces.

results.title: Profile Emerges of Suspect
results.abstract: The gunman is believed to be Ayoub El Kahzani, of Moroccan origin, who was known to the Spanish and French security services and is reported to have traveled to Syria last year.

results.title: Far Rockaway a Testing Ground for Community Policing
results.abstract: The 101st Precinct in Far Rockaway, a low-income neighborhood wary of the police, has seen halting progress as the department seeks to reshape everyday interactions between officers and residents.

results.title: A Year After War, People of Gaza Still Sit Among the Ruins
results.abstract: Not a single one of the nearly 18,000 homes destroyed or severely damaged in last summer’s war is habitable.
results.byline: By JODI RUDOREN and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

results.title: Immigrant Children’s Cases Overwhelm New York Courts
results.abstract: After fleeing violence in their Central American homelands, thousands of minors are crowding courtrooms in New York City and Long Island that are ill equipped to handle the volume.

results.title: ‘NeuroTribes,’ by Steve Silberman
results.abstract: A science journalist’s reading of medical history suggests that the “autism pandemic” is an optical illusion.
des_facet: NeuroTribes: The Legacy of Autism and the Future of Neurodiversity (Book)

results.title: Bolt Holds Off Gatlin to Win World 100-Meter Title
results.abstract: In a final that was billed as a morality play, Bolt finished one-hundreth of a second ahead of Gatlin, taking his third 100-meter world title.

results.title: With Force Deployments, North Korea Raises Stakes
results.abstract: As negotiators from both sides resumed talks in a border village on Sunday afternoon, Pyongyang was deploying more artillery toward the border, the South said.

results.title: Giant Panda Gives Birth to Two Cubs at National Zoo
results.abstract: Mei Xiang, a giant panda at Washington’s National Zoo, gave birth to twin cubs three days after her pregnancy was discovered.

results.title: Migrants Rush Across Border in Macedonia
results.abstract: Thousands of refugees managed to get past a cordon set up to prevent them from crossing into the country from Greece.

results.title: Modern Love: One Life, Shaken and Stirred
results.abstract: He said he didn’t like martinis, but she said to trust her. They went down like candy. They danced to the Bee Gees on the jukebox, and he kissed her.

results.title: The Creative Apocalypse That Wasn’t
results.abstract: In the digital economy, it was supposed to be impossible to make money by making art. Instead, creative careers are thriving — but in complicated and unexpected ways.
